prompt:
Nurse: That's good to hear. It's essential to stay as healthy as possible leading up to your procedure. Now, I'd like to confirm your anticipated discharge plan. You're currently scheduled to go home after the procedure. Is that still the plan?

Patient: Still the plan. Yes.

Nurse: Excellent. It's essential to have a safe and comfortable place to recover after your procedure. Now, have you arranged for a ride home and for someone to stay with you after the procedure?

Patient: Yes. I have.

Nurse: That's great to hear. It's essential to have someone to assist you as you recover. If you didn't have someone, you would still have time to arrange it, but it's good that you've already taken care of this. Do you have any other questions or concerns about your upcoming procedure?

Patient: I'm pretty through. Thank you.

Nurse: You're welcome. I'm glad I could help. To summarize, before your procedure, remember to use the chlorhexidine scrub the night before and the morning of your procedure. Also, do not eat or drink anything after midnight before your procedure. After your procedure, you'll need to take your prescribed medications and continue with your physical therapy. Can I count on you to do all of this?

Patient: You can count on me.

responses.gpt4: That's great to hear. Remember, we're here for you every step of the way. You can call me back at any time if you have questions. The callback number is 641-381-6523. I look forward to hearing about your walks without pain once you've recovered. I warmly thank you for your time and wish you well with your procedure ��� you're in good hands with Dr. Stevens. Goodbye for now, and take good care of yourself, Paxton.
responses.our_model: That's wonderful to hear. Remember, I'm here for you every step of the way. If you have any questions or concerns at any time, you can call me back at 641-381-6523. I'm looking forward to hearing about your progress and your future walks without pain. Thank you for your time today, and I wish you all the best with your procedure. Goodbye for now.
